content:
• Wednesday, June 12, 2013

  • Stocks plunge in Tokyo as the Nikkei (EWJ, DXJ) tumbles 5.6% touching a two-month low of 12,543....

    Stocks plunge in Tokyo as the Nikkei (EWJ, DXJ) tumbles 5.6% touching a two-month low of 12,543. The USD/JPY slides 1.4% at last check to ¥94.69 (FXY).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 PM | 11 Comments
  • SIGM

    Sigma Designs (NASDAQ:SIGM)  -7.4% AH following its mixed FQ1 results. FQ2 guidance is for...

    Sigma Designs (NASDAQ:SIGM)  -7.4% AH following its mixed FQ1 results. FQ2 guidance is for revenue of $52M-$54M, in-line with a $53.2M consensus but possibly disappointing investors in light of strong guidance from STMicroelectronics, Broadcom, and other home electronics chipmakers. FQ1 gross margin was 54.7%, +270 bps Q/Q and above guidance of 52%-53%. GM is expected to fall back to 52%-53% in FQ2, but opex is also expected to decline thanks to ongoing restructuring efforts ($45M in FY14 cost savings targeted). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM
  • CLDT

    Chatham Lodging Trust (NYSE:CLDT) announces a 4.5M share public offering. The company will...

    Chatham Lodging Trust (NYSE:CLDT) announces a 4.5M share public offering. The company will contribute the net proceeds to its operating partnership in exchange for common units of limited partnership interest in the operating partnership. The operating partnership will then use a portion of the net proceeds to repay debt under its senior secured revolving credit facility and to fund the acquisition of the 178-room Hyatt Place Pittsburgh/North Shore in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. Shares -1.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • SWY

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SWY +30%. SPRD +25%. PVH +7%. PSMI +6%. SVU +6%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SWY +30%. SPRD +25%. PVH +7%. PSMI +6%. SVU +6%.
    After-hours top losers: SIGM -8%. QCOR -7%. SQNM -5%. ECYT -3%. VLCCF -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 3 Comments
  • KR

    Kroger (NYSE:KR) +1.8% AH and Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) +4.5% after Safeway announces it's selling...

    Kroger (NYSE:KR) +1.8% AH and Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) +4.5% after Safeway announces it's selling its Canadian ops for C$5.8B ($5.7B), and suggests "the higher multiples attributed to Canadian supermarket companies" were a factor behind its decision.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • HMA

    Health Management Associates (NYSE:HMA) confirms that it's in discussions with advisors, saying...

    Health Management Associates (NYSE:HMA) confirms that it's in discussions with advisors, saying that its board has engaged Morgan Stanley and Weil, Gotshal & Manges in connection with the accumulation of shares by Glenview Capital, as well as to consider all strategic alternatives available. HMA doesn't intend to disclose any further developments until it's appropriate. In addition, a committee has been formed to lead a search for potential candidates to replace Gary Newsome, who will be retiring effective July 31. Shares +2.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum (NASDAQ:SPRD) +24.3% AH after resuming trading in the wake of its big Q2 guidance...

    Spreadtrum (NASDAQ:SPRD) +24.3% AH after resuming trading in the wake of its big Q2 guidance hike. Mobile chipmakers with decent Chinese exposure are rallying in sympathy; in addition to the numbers, Spreadtrum's remarks about strong demand for low-end smartphones in China and other emerging markets are likely going over well. RFMD +2% AH. SWKS +3%. QCOM +0.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 5 Comments
  • PVH

    More on PVH's Q1: Non-GAAP EPS comes in well ahead of both company and Street estimates. Revenue...

    More on PVH's Q1: Non-GAAP EPS comes in well ahead of both company and Street estimates. Revenue jumps 36% Y/Y due to the acquisition of Warnaco and gains at Tommy Hilfiger. On a segment-by-segment basis, comps growth was 4% and 5% for Calvin Klein North America and International, respectively, 5% and 4% for Tommy Hilfiger North America and International, and -7% for Heritage Brands. FY13 guidance reiterated at $7/share on $8.2B in sales. Shares +7.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum (NASDAQ:SPRD) raises its Q2 revenue guidance range to $270M-$278M, well above a prior...

    Spreadtrum (NASDAQ:SPRD) raises its Q2 revenue guidance range to $270M-$278M, well above a prior range of $220M-$228M and a $224.1M consensus. The Chinese baseband chipmaker cites "continuing strong demand throughout the quarter for low-cost smartphones" in China and other emerging markets, and says it's "also benefiting from the continuing expansion of our smartphone portfolio." Those were a couple of the positive catalysts SA Pro contributor Ashraf Eassa recently mentioned in a bullish write-up. Shares are halted. Marvell (NASDAQ:MRVL), which competes with Spreadtrum in the TD-SCDMA 3G baseband space, is up 1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • SWY

    Safeway (NYSE:SWY) +23.6% AH on news Empire Company's (EMP.A) Sobeys unit is buying Safeway's...

    Safeway (NYSE:SWY) +23.6% AH on news Empire Company's (EMP.A) Sobeys unit is buying Safeway's Canadian ops (Canada Safeway) for C$5.8B ($5.7B).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 3 Comments
  • FIVE

    More on Five Below's (NASDAQ:FIVE) Q1: The company opens 14 new stores during the period and...

    More on Five Below's (NASDAQ:FIVE) Q1: The company opens 14 new stores during the period and comps growth comes in at 4.2%. CEO Thomas Vellios notes that the results "came in ahead of original guidance." Trends improved during the second half of the quarter as consumer "headwinds abated." Outlook: FIVE sees Q2 adjusted EPS, revenue, and comps growth of $0.08-0.09, $112-114M, and 4-5% respectively. For the full year, management expects $0.65-0.68/share on revenue of $524-529M. Shares +6.9% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • MSFT

    Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) isn't interested in Nook Media's (BKS -6.1%) digital assets, sources...

    Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) isn't interested in Nook Media's (BKS -6.1%) digital assets, sources tell dealReporter. The report led Barnes & Noble shares to dive over the final 15 minutes of trading. TechCrunch reported of Microsoft's interest in Nook Media last month, but a source later told Insider Monkey Microsoft "has no intention" of making a deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • S

    Clearwire's (CLWR +0.5%) board plans to endorse Dish's (DISH -3.9%) $4.40/share tender offer and...

    Clearwire's (CLWR +0.5%) board plans to endorse Dish's (DISH -3.9%) $4.40/share tender offer and postpone a Thursday shareholder vote on majority owner Sprint's (S -0.1%) $3.40/share buyout offer, the WSJ reports. The reports comes two days after Sprint gave its support to SoftBank's (OTCPK:SFTBF) revised offer for the company, and set a June 18 deadline for Dish to make its final offer. Sprint and Dish have been arguing over the legality (I, II) of Dish's bid for Clearwire. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • ETN

    CEO Alexander Cutler says Eaton (ETN -1.5%) has no plans to sell its auto parts business,...

    CEO Alexander Cutler says Eaton (ETN -1.5%) has no plans to sell its auto parts business, refuting a report earlier this week that ETN was weighing a sale in order to focus more on its electrical products businesses. Even though ETN's Q1 auto parts sales slipped 11% and operating profit dropped 17.5% Y/Y, Cutler says he's "bullish about [auto's] prospects."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • ROYL

    Royale Energy (OTC:ROYL +13.5%) soars after announcing a new gas discovery at its Zodiac well....

    Royale Energy (OTC:ROYL +13.5%) soars after announcing a new gas discovery at its Zodiac well. The company encounters "three productive formations" and will begin production for the first completed and tested zone at 700K cubic ft. per day. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -9%) falls sharply on news of its 8.5M-share sale, but MoneyBeat says the deal...

    First Solar (FSLR -9%) falls sharply on news of its 8.5M-share sale, but MoneyBeat says the deal is well-timed, given the stock’s near-doubling in recent months and investors’ generally warm reception to recent corporate stock sales. FSLR plans to use proceeds for potential acquisitions or investments in solar power projects; Goldman Sachs calls the move “a positive and opportunistic maneuver” to prepare for such ends.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 3 Comments
  • O

    Renewed selling also hits equity REITs, with the Vanguard REIT ETF (VNQ -1.3%) just holding onto...

    Renewed selling also hits equity REITs, with the Vanguard REIT ETF (VNQ -1.3%) just holding onto gains YTD; the iShares Real Estate ETF (IYR -1.4%). Among individual stocks, Realty Income (O -1.6%) is off 22% in 3 weeks; Senior Housing (SNH -2.3%), Digital Realty (DLR -4%) American Capital Realty (ARCP -2.1%), Omega Healthcare (OHI -1.7%). Among the best performers is HCP, Inc. (HCP -0.9%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM | 9 Comments
  • PMFG

    PMFG (PMFG -1%) has been awarded a $12.6M contract for a selective catalytic reduction system,...

    PMFG (PMFG -1%) has been awarded a $12.6M contract for a selective catalytic reduction system, which will be used on a methanol unit at a chemical plant in Texas. Delivery is scheduled for second half of 2014, with revenue to be recognized from FY13 thru FY15, with the majority in FY2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • LYV

    Live Nation (LYV +7.8%) dances higher after an arbitrator rules in the company's favor in a...

    Live Nation (LYV +7.8%) dances higher after an arbitrator rules in the company's favor in a dispute over a software licensing agreement with German ticketing company CTS Eventim. LYV "validly terminated" the agreement and thus "has no liability to CTS," the arbitrator says. For his part, CEO Michael Rapino is "not surprised." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • ENB

    The action at Spectra Energy may not end with its MLP dropdown news; the company could come...

    The action at Spectra Energy may not end with its MLP dropdown news; the company could come under pressure to do more after activist investor Sandell Asset Management says it has amassed a 2.3M-share stake. The hedge fund has told SE to explore alternatives for its Canadian business, including going public, and cut operating costs to return more to shareholders. SE +10.7%, SEP +4.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • ARR

    Treasurys (TLT -1.2%) fail to catch a bid even as the Dow drops triple digits. Panicky action...

    Treasurys (TLT -1.2%) fail to catch a bid even as the Dow drops triple digits. Panicky action continues in income favorites (REM -1.3%), notably Armour Residential (ARR -4.7%), where the selling has now spread to its preferred shares, the series B off 2%. The common is off 28% over the last month. Some others: New York Mortgage (NYMT -2.7%), American Capital (MTGE -2.6%), Western Asset (WMC -3.9%), Annaly (NLY -1.7%), Dynex (DX -2.6%), New Residential (NRZ -3.6%), Ellington Financial (EFC -2.2%).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 11 Comments
  • AMRI

    The profitability of Albany Molecular's (AMRI +9.9%) "core business could reach historic...

    The profitability of Albany Molecular's (AMRI +9.9%) "core business could reach historic levels," Sterne Agee says, citing the expected "resurgence in preclinical-PI activity over the next several years." Analyst Greg Bolan resumes coverage at Buy with a $15 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • AMGN

    A bit of sell-side commentary regarding Amgen's (AMGN -1.6%) announcement of top-line data from...

    A bit of sell-side commentary regarding Amgen's (AMGN -1.6%) announcement of top-line data from a Phase 3 trebananib trial (previous): DB analyst Robyn Karnauskas notes that sales of the treatment are not factored into the bank's estimates and as such, any "success would present upside to estimates." Karnauskas also likes the "positive" data released on the Psoriatic arthritis treatment Brodalumab. Nevertheless, concerns about Enbrel's competitive edge over cheaper generics are weighing on shares. (Other Psoriatic arthritis news: Apremilast effective)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • GOLD

    Gold miners (GDX +1%) turn positive as gold climbs past $1,390/oz.: ABX +0.9%, GG +1.1%, NEM...

    Gold miners (GDX +1%) turn positive as gold climbs past $1,390/oz.: ABX +0.9%, GG +1.1%, NEM +1.2%, IAG +2.1%, GFI +1.3%, AUY +2.4%, NGD +1.3%. The link between gold miners and gold has been strong lately: The 24-day correlation between the spot price of gold and GDX has remained above 90% for five days, the longest such streak since July 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 5 Comments
  • ATEC

    Alphatec (ATEC -1.5%) postpones its 2013 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, originally scheduled...

    Alphatec (ATEC -1.5%) postpones its 2013 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, originally scheduled for Monday, June 17. It will now take place on Friday, June 21, at 2:00pm PST. The company postponed the annual meeting in order to provide additional time for stockholders to review the amendment to increase the per person annual award limit contained in the plan from 200,000 shares to 1.5z, shares per year and to provide additional disclosure with respect to certain other proposals in the proxy statement.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • CERE

    Raymond James reiterates an Outperform rating on shares of agricultural biotech Ceres (CERE...

    Raymond James reiterates an Outperform rating on shares of agricultural biotech Ceres (CERE +60.9%), noting that with a $7 price target, now may be an "attractive entry point." The catalyst? Why, the imminent disclosure of "sweet sorghum yields" of course, which is "the key commercialization milestone that the market has been waiting for."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • AKAM

    Akamai (AKAM -2.8%) is having a rough day. optionMONSTER notes a major bearish put spread trade...

    Akamai (AKAM -2.8%) is having a rough day. optionMONSTER notes a major bearish put spread trade was made today: 4K Akamai January 45 puts were bought for $6.45, and the same number of January 35 puts were sold for $2.15. The content delivery network owner rallied strongly in April thanks to its Q1 beat and strong Q2 revenue guidance, but has been edging lower over the last month.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • GREK

    Stocks in Greece (GREK -3%) fall for a third day as the ASE sheds 3.2% — the index is now...

    Stocks in Greece (GREK -3%) fall for a third day as the ASE sheds 3.2% — the index is now down nearly 11% in three sessions. A 24-hour strike called by the country's two largest labor unions in protest of the ERT shutdown has conspired with the failed DEPA privatization effort to dent confidence in what as of today is no longer a "developed market" in the eyes of MSCI.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • TEX

    Terex (TEX -2%) slips today, despite Stifel Nicolaus initiating coverage on the shares with...

    Terex (TEX -2%) slips today, despite Stifel Nicolaus initiating coverage on the shares with a Buy and a $44 price target. Stifel calls it a leading solutions provider with strong market share positions across most of its businesses in which it operates. Historically, acquisitions have been a key growth vehicle for the company, accounting for nearly 90% of its business. But the company has shifted focus toward improving existing operations, and expects profitable growth and cash generation in the coming upcycle.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • BGMD

    BG Medicine (OTC:BGMD +2.8%) moves up after saying that galectin-3 testing has been recognized...

    BG Medicine (OTC:BGMD +2.8%) moves up after saying that galectin-3 testing has been recognized as a biomarker for myocardial fibrosis in the 2013 American College of Cardiology Foundation and the American Heart Association Guideline for the Management of Heart Failure. The guideline states that Galectin-3 testing may be useful in helping determine which patients are at higher risk of death or hospitalization, including 30-day readmission, and further notes that testing is also predictive of risk of adverse outcomes.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • STJ

    Deutsche Bank (Buy) thinks the approval of St. Jude Medical's (STJ +2.6%) implantable...

    Deutsche Bank (Buy) thinks the approval of St. Jude Medical's (STJ +2.6%) implantable cardioverter and cardiac resynchronization defibrillators is a "good sign," as it may signal that STJ is "making progress" with its efforts to allay concerns tied to an FDA inspection of the company's Sylmar, California manufacturing facility. Wedbush's Tao Levy concurs, noting that the FDA "viewed the safety enhancements of the Ellipse and Assura as important enough to approve despite the warning letter."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • CERE

    Midday top 10 gainers: CERE +73%. CTB +41%. SGOC +28%. ULTA +17%. GPRC +14%. SE +10%. UQM +9%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: CERE +73%. CTB +41%. SGOC +28%. ULTA +17%. GPRC +14%. SE +10%. UQM +9%. OTC:AFFY +9%. AMED +9%. HMA +9%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: IQNT -17%. KNDI -17%. CLSN -14%. OTCQB:TELK -12%. RLOG -12%. VRTB -11%. OSH -11%. CBAK-OLD -11%. OTC:ECTE -10%. CTC -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • GALT

    Galectin Therapeutics (GALT +3%) gains after saying preclinical studies show that combining its...

    Galectin Therapeutics (GALT +3%) gains after saying preclinical studies show that combining its galectin inhibitor GR-MD-02 with other antibodies may help shrink breast and prostate tumors. The tests showed that when GR-MD-02 - a drug that inhibits galectin proteins - was added with immune checkpoint blockade inhibitors anti-CTLA-4 or anti-PD-1, tumor shrinkage was increased and survival was enhanced in immune competent mice with prostate and breast cancers.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • TSN

    Corn (CORN -1.8%) gives up early gains and turns sharply lower after the USDA estimates 2013/14...

    Corn (CORN -1.8%) gives up early gains and turns sharply lower after the USDA estimates 2013/14 ending stocks of 151.8M tons, above the trade estimate of 149.6M. The USDA cut its yield projection by 1.5 bushels to 156.5 bushels/acre, but lower feed usage and no reduction in planted acreage (despite spring delays) has stocks higher. Tyson (TSN +0.9%) and Pilgrim's Pride (PPC +1.9%) cheer the news. The data was bearish for beans (SOYB -1.8%) as well. Grains ETF (JJG -1.3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • FIO

    Rick White, a Fusion-io (FIO -3.6%) co-founder and until recently the company's CMO, has...

    Rick White, a Fusion-io (FIO -3.6%) co-founder and until recently the company's CMO, has resigned from Fusion-io's board. When announcing White's resignation as CMO last month, Fusion-io stated both White and outgoing CEO David Flynn would remain board members, and would also "serve in advisory roles" for 12 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • CLSN

    Celsion (CLSN -11.8%) CEO Michael Tardungo makes a statement in the face of today's weakness,...

    Celsion (CLSN -11.8%) CEO Michael Tardungo makes a statement in the face of today's weakness, buying 10K shares at an average price of $1.3457. The stock was hammered hard overnight on the back of a negative article posted in Seeking Alpha late yesterday and has been trying to claw its way out of the hole all morning, but it still has a long way to go just to reach breakeven with yesterday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • MANU

    Shares of Manchester United (MANU -2.7%) get kicked on reports the club will pay $26.6M to sign...

    Shares of Manchester United (MANU -2.7%) get kicked on reports the club will pay $26.6M to sign defender Ezequiel Garay. Some appear worried about the effect such a large outlay could have on the company's cash position.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • USAP

    Universal Stainless (USAP +2%) moves up today after announcing earlier that it's been given the...

    Universal Stainless (USAP +2%) moves up today after announcing earlier that it's been given the stamp of approval from the National Aerospace and Defense Contractors Accreditation Program for its Heat Treat process at its Dunkirk Specialty Steel facility. The Nadcap program is the leading accreditation for major companies and their suppliers for managing special processes and products within the aerospace and defense industries.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • MILL

    Miller Energy (MILL +2%) says its Cook Inlet Energy subsidiary hopes to place the RU-2A well in...

    Miller Energy (MILL +2%) says its Cook Inlet Energy subsidiary hopes to place the RU-2A well in Alaska on production within several days. The new bottomhole location is 46 ft. higher on structure than the original RU-2 well, implying the chance for better recovery than the original well. Cumulative production from RU-2 is 500K bbl, and the target at the sidetrack is ~950K bbl recoverable.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • LULU

    Lululemon (LULU -2.5%) slips again to trade at its lowest level since early April in the wake of...

    Lululemon (LULU -2.5%) slips again to trade at its lowest level since early April in the wake of a CEO resignation and a troubling earnings report. Perhaps most concerning for investors is the four open vacancies in its senior ranks that leaves the retailer looking rudderless. For LULU to see $80 again anytime soon, analysts think those hires need to be transcendent.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM | 5 Comments
  • GCAP

    Shares of Gain Capital (GCAP +5.2%) are trading higher early. In a still-embargoed article...

    Shares of Gain Capital (GCAP +5.2%) are trading higher early. In a still-embargoed article published today, SA Pro contributor Intangible Valuation (who recommended "observation" of the shares some 20% ago) says the stock may have "some more ground to run" on the heels of its Global Futures & Forex acquisition.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • MPLX

    MPLX (MPLX -2.4%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at BAML, which recognizes the MLP's...

    MPLX (MPLX -2.4%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at BAML, which recognizes the MLP's peer-leading distribution growth, supportive general partner, dowry of drop-downs and fee-based cash flows, but sees units largely pricing in this growth given its current yield of 2.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • CYTK

    Cytokinetics (CYTK +10%) trades higher coming off an earlier trading halt following the...

    Cytokinetics (CYTK +10%) trades higher coming off an earlier trading halt following the company's announcement that it's expanded its strategic collaboration with Amgen (AMGN -0.7%) to include Japan. In 2006, the two companies entered into a deal to develop and commercialize small-molecule therapeutics for the treatment of heart failure, with omecamtiv mecarbil as their most advanced candidate. Initially, CYTK's license to AMGN excluded Japan, but under the expansion, it will now include Japan and cover additional products as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM

  • Tobacco stocks are holding up well even in the face of news that the U.K. will regulate...

    Tobacco stocks are holding up well even in the face of news that the U.K. will regulate electronic cigarettes. The same can't be said with Vapor Corp (VPCO.PK -1.2%) which is a pure-play e-cigarette stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • HLF

    Herb Greenberg, ever the skeptic, requests a copy of the full Nielsen report which has shares of...

    Herb Greenberg, ever the skeptic, requests a copy of the full Nielsen report which has shares of Herbalife (HLF +7.3%) surging (previous). According to Greenberg, the company's response was: "No, sorry."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 17 Comments
  • HPQ

    It's "still possible" for H-P (HPQ +4.7%) to deliver revenue growth in FY14 (ends Oct. '14),...

    It's "still possible" for H-P (HPQ +4.7%) to deliver revenue growth in FY14 (ends Oct. '14), says Meg Whitman in a CNBC appearance (video) that has brought the IT giant's shares to within pennies of their 52-week high. Analysts currently expect H-P's FY14 sales to fall 2.2% in FY14, after declining 7.4% in FY13. Whitman also admits H-P's struggling PC ops remains the company's "biggest wild card," and (in spite of intense competition) says H-P needs to expand its mobile offerings to "other operating systems" (Android seems a good bet). (yesterday)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 4 Comments
  • MDRX

    Allscripts (MDRX -1.3%) slips into the red today on the back of its announcement of a $300M...

    Allscripts (MDRX -1.3%) slips into the red today on the back of its announcement of a $300M private offering of cash convertible senior notes due 2020, with an option to purchase an additional $45M. Separately, Sterne Agee's Greg Bolan resumed coverage on the stock this morning with a Buy rating and a $17 price target. Bolan says that MDRX's reshuffling of leadership, major product upgrades and reorganization put the company in just "the 3rd inning of a long-term turnaround."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • RFIL

    Shares of RF Industries (RFIL -7.9%) slide after the company reports FQ2 EPS of $0.14 on revenue...

    Shares of RF Industries (RFIL -7.9%) slide after the company reports FQ2 EPS of $0.14 on revenue of $9.2M (+37% Y/Y). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • GIMO

    Gigamon's (NYSE:GIMO) IPO doesn't disappoint. Shares opened at $23.08 and and have since rallied...

    Gigamon's (NYSE:GIMO) IPO doesn't disappoint. Shares opened at $23.08 and and have since rallied to $24.93, good for a 31.2% gain and a valuation of $734M (7.6x 2012 sales) . The maker of network monitoring/analysis switches (Gigamon's products interact with traditional monitoring/security appliances) posted Q1 revenue of $25.8M (+55% Y/Y), and a net loss of $1.2M. Its deferred revenue balance totaled $35.2M. (earlier) (S-1) (IPO preview)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • FSYS

    Fuel Systems Solutions (FSYS +4.5%) trades higher as shares threaten to break past a multi-month...

    Fuel Systems Solutions (FSYS +4.5%) trades higher as shares threaten to break past a multi-month ceiling. The rise of Tesla has taken some of the attention away from natural gas engine solutions, but in China and Indonesia talk has been increasing on alternative fuel systems other than electric.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +2.4%) puts its $3.3B Ring of Fire chromite project in Ontario on...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +2.4%) puts its $3.3B Ring of Fire chromite project in Ontario on hold due to unresolved land rights and unfinished agreements with the provincial government. BMO says the suspension is a positive for CLF since it frees up ~$3.4B of cash flow to reduce debt - "very big news that it not yet on people's radar... this can squeeze quite a bit on this," a trader says.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 8 Comments
  • BIIB

    Biogen (BIIB -2.7%) slides after Citi analyst Yaron Werber raises concerns about regulatory data...
